result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James C. Livermore

records.addlTxt:
Court calls @ 2:25 PM/ RM 301, 22CF200 & 22CF201.  Defendant James C. Livermore in court.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. State notes no report filed from PD Office. Def. has contacted a private Atty. and is waiting to hear back. State reviews case history and requests an Adjourned Initial Appearance at a later date. Bond remains.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

No contact with victim or victims residence.
No possession of dangerous weapons.
Defendant to apply with Public Defender within 7 days at 715-536-9105.

Court calls @ 2:05 PM/ RM 301, 22CF200 & 22CF201. Defendant James C. Livermore appeared by video, in custody in Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Kelly Hays in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Court Commissioner Brent DeBord in Court, via zoom, from Oconto. Def. has copies of complaints, advised of charges and penalties. Def. given Atty rights and given 4 options, PD, hire own, court appointed Atty. or represent self. Def. wishes to attain counsel. Defendant to apply with Public Defender within 7 days at 715-536-9105. State is in compliance with victims rights. State gives bail bond recommendations and requests a $3,000.00 cash bond, to cover both files, with conditions of No contact with victim or victims residence and Def. to not use or attain any dangerous weapons. Def. gives bail bond argument. Court considers bail bond factors and orders a $3,000.00 cash bond, to cover both files, with conditions of No contact with victim or victims residence, No possession of dangerous weapons and Defendant to apply with Public Defender within 7 days at 715-536-9105. Court questions if Def. would like to waive time limits for P.H. Def. waives time limits on P.H. and wishes to wait for counsel. Court accepts waiver of time limits for P.H.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
